summary: The 'Easy Enrollment in Health Care Act' aims to streamline enrollment in health insurance affordability programs. It establishes a program allowing taxpayers to elect to have their eligibility for such programs determined and facilitate enrollment during federal tax return filing. The bill modifies existing laws to enable data sharing between the IRS and healthcare exchanges, allowing for automatic enrollment in zero-premium health plans and improving eligibility verification. It also includes provisions for addressing errors in eligibility and establishing an advisory committee.
